The internet has 4.54 billion users.
There are 3.725 billion active social media users
On average, people have 7.6 social media accounts
Facebook Messenger and Whatsapp handle 60 billion messages a day
81% of teenagers felt social media has a positive effect on their lives
There are an estimated 270 million fake Facebook profiles
Facebook has 5 million active advertisers on the platform.
Facebook adds 500,000 new users every day; 6 new profiles every second
There are 500 million Tweets sent each day. That’s 6,000 Tweets every second
77% of Twitter users feel more positive about a brand when their Tweet has been replied to
People now watch 1 billion hours of YouTube videos every day
The most liked picture on Instagram is one of an egg

In a survey of 1,800 people, women reported being more stressed than men. Twitter was found to be a “significant contributor” because it increased their awareness of other people’s stress. Confusingly it seems Twitter also acted as a coping mechanism – the more women used it, the less stressed they were.
In a 2014 Austrian study, it was found that participants reported lower moods after using Facebook for 20 minutes vs other internet use.
A 2017 study in the journal for Computers in Human Behavior found a correlation between the number of social media platforms used by an individual, and their levels of anxiety and depression.
Why on Earth do Bristolians occasionally enjoy mega men?
